Complexity

Computes spatial configuration complexity.

Authors:

  • Giuseppe Boccignone <giuseppe.boccignone@unimi.it>

  • Renato Nobre <renato.avellarnobre@studenti.unimi.it>

Changes:

  • 12/12/2012 First Edition Matlab

  • 31/05/2022 Python Edition

class complexity.Complexity[source]

Handle computation of spatial configuration complexity.

Note

Other complexity algorithm functions can be added here.

order

List of order values

Type

list of float

disorder

List of disorder values

Type

list of float

complexity

List of complexity values

Type

list of float

c_type

Complexity algotithm type to execute defined on config.py

compute_complexity(histmat, N, n_bins)[source]

Computes spatial configuration complexity \(C(t)\) of Interest points.

The function is a simple wrapper for complexity computation. Executes some kind of complexity algorithm which is defined from the class parameter self.c_type by calling the appropriate function.

Parameters

  • histmat (np.ndarray) – 2D Spatial histogram of IPs.

  • N (float) – number of points.

  • n_bins (int) – number of bins.

Returns

  • disorder (float) – Disorder value.

  • order (float) – Order value.

  • complexity (float) – Space complexity value.

Raises

NotImplementedError – If desired complexity type was not implemented.

Examples

>>> disorder, order, compl = esComputeComplexity('SDL', histmat, N, n_bins)
_shiner_davison_landsberg(H, n_bins)[source]

Shiner-Davison-Landsberg (SDL) complexity.

For more information, see the reference below 1.

Parameters

  • H (float) – Shannon Entropy (Boltzman-Gibbs entropy).

  • n_bins (int) – number of bins.

Returns

  • order (float) – Order value.

  • disorder (float) – Disorder value.

References

1

Shiner, J. S., Davison, M., & Landsberg, P. T. (1999). Simple measure for complexity. Physical review E, 59(2), 1459.

_lopez_ruiz_mancini(H, phistmat, n_bins)[source]

Lòpez-Ruiz, Mancini, and Calbet complexity.

D is called Disequilibrium. This quantity is a measure of the divergence of the given probability distribution from the uniform one. For more information, see the reference below 2.

Parameters

  • H (float) – Shannon Entropy (Boltzman-Gibbs entropy)

  • phistmat (np.ndarray) – 2D Spatial histogram of IPs devided by number of points.

  • n_bins (int) – number of bins.

Returns

  • order (float) – Order value.

  • disorder (float) – Disorder value.

References

2

Lopez-Ruiz, R., Mancini, H. L., & Calbet, X. (1995). A statistical measure of complexity. Physics letters A, 209(5-6), 321-326.

_feldman_crutchfield(H, phistmat, n_bins)[source]

Feldman and Crutchfield’s amendment replaces Order with the Kullback-Leibler divergence.

For the purpose of serving as a component of complexity, one of the compared distributions is taken to be uniform. For more information, see the reference below 3.

Parameters

  • H (float) – Shannon Entropy (Boltzman-Gibbs entropy)

  • phistmat (np.ndarray) – 2D Spatial histogram of IPs devided by number of points.

  • n_bins (int) – number of bins.

Returns

  • order (float) – Order value.

  • disorder (float) – Disorder value.

References

3

Feldman, D. P., & Crutchfield, J. P. (1998). Measures of statistical complexity: Why?. Physics Letters A, 238(4-5), 244-252.
